thinking.disposable_income: North Lawndale has a median income of $33,334 and a per capita income of $21,201. A significant portion of the population earns less than $25,000, indicating limited disposable income.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With 42.3% of households earning less than $25,000, discretionary spending is likely constrained. Any increase in transportation costs could significantly impact the ability to spend on other necessities.
thinking.accessibility: 36.5% of households do not own a vehicle, and 23.7% of residents use transit. Improving transit accessibility and affordability is crucial for this community.
thinking.decision_rationale: Given the low income levels and high reliance on transit, policies that minimize costs while improving transit times are prioritized. A lower fare and moderate tax are preferred to balance affordability and service improvement. Driver fees are considered to reduce congestion and improve transit times, benefiting the significant transit-using population.
